test_suites.description: Tests for user signup, login, Google Sign-In, profile updates, and parental controls.

test_cases.name: Successful user signup with email and password
test_cases.description: Verify that a new user can successfully create an account using email and password.
steps: Navigate to the signup page.
Enter a unique email address (e.g., test_signup_[timestamp]@example.com).
Enter a strong password.
Confirm the password.
Click the 'Sign Up' button.
Verify successful redirection to the profile setup or dashboard.
test_cases.expected_result: User account is created, and the user is logged in.

test_cases.name: User signup with existing email
test_cases.description: Verify that a user cannot sign up with an email address that already exists.
steps: Navigate to the signup page.
Enter an email address that is already registered.
Enter a password.
Confirm the password.
Click the 'Sign Up' button.
Verify an appropriate error message is displayed.
test_cases.expected_result: Error message indicating the email is already in use is displayed. Account is not created.

test_cases.name: Successful user login with email and password
test_cases.description: Verify that an existing user can log in using their registered email and password.
steps: Navigate to the login page.
Enter a registered email address.
Enter the correct password.
Click the 'Login' button.
Verify successful redirection to the dashboard or home page.
test_cases.expected_result: User is logged in successfully and redirected to their dashboard.

test_cases.name: User login with incorrect password
test_cases.description: Verify that a user cannot log in with an incorrect password.
steps: Navigate to the login page.
Enter a registered email address.
Enter an incorrect password.
Click the 'Login' button.
Verify an appropriate error message is displayed.
test_cases.expected_result: Error message indicating invalid credentials is displayed. User is not logged in.

test_cases.name: Successful Google Sign-In
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can sign up or log in using their Google account.
steps: Navigate to the signup/login page.
Click the 'Sign in with Google' button.
Complete the Google authentication flow (select account, grant permissions).
Verify successful redirection to the dashboard or profile setup.
test_cases.expected_result: User is authenticated via Google and logged into FamilyFlow.

test_cases.name: User profile creation and update
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can set up and update their profile information (name, age, avatar).
steps: Log in to the application.
Navigate to the 'Profile' or 'Account Settings' section.
Enter a display name.
Enter an age.
Upload a valid avatar image.
Click 'Save' or 'Update Profile'.
Verify that the profile information is updated correctly.
Navigate away and back to the profile page to confirm persistence.
test_cases.expected_result: Profile information is saved and displayed correctly. Avatar is uploaded and visible.

test_cases.name: Parental control: Child account creation
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can create a child account with controlled permissions.
steps: Log in as a parent user.
Navigate to 'Family Management' or 'Add Member'.
Enter child's details (name, potentially age/DOB).
Assign a role (e.g., 'child').
Set initial permissions (e.g., access to tasks, calendar view only).
Save the child account.
Log out as parent and log in as the newly created child.
Verify the child's limited access based on set permissions.
test_cases.expected_result: Child account is created successfully under the parent's family. Permissions are correctly applied.

test_cases.name: Parental control: Modifying child permissions
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can modify the permissions of an existing child account.
steps: Log in as a parent user.
Navigate to 'Family Management' or the specific child's profile.
Access the permissions settings for the child.
Modify permissions (e.g., grant 'can_edit_calendar' ability).
Save changes.
Log in as the child.
Verify the updated permissions are active.
test_cases.expected_result: Parent can successfully update child permissions, and these changes are reflected for the child user.

test_suites.description: Tests for creating, editing, deleting, assigning, and categorizing family events, including real-time updates.

test_cases.name: Add a new family event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can add a new event to the shared family calendar.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the Calendar view.
Click the 'Add Event' button.
Fill in event details: title, start time, end time.
Optionally assign to a family member.
Optionally select an event category.
Save the event.
Verify the event appears on the calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: The new event is successfully added to the family calendar and visible to all family members.

test_cases.name: Edit an existing family event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can edit the details of an existing event.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the Calendar view.
Select an existing event.
Click the 'Edit' button.
Modify event details (e.g., change title, time).
Save the changes.
Verify the event details are updated on the calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: The event is successfully updated with the new details.

test_cases.name: Delete an existing family event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can delete an event from the calendar.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the Calendar view.
Select an existing event.
Click the 'Delete' button.
Confirm deletion if prompted.
Verify the event is removed from the calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: The event is successfully removed from the family calendar.

test_cases.name: Real-time update for shared parent accounts
test_cases.description: Verify that changes made by one parent are reflected immediately for another shared parent.
steps: Log in as Parent A.
Open the Calendar view.
Log in as Parent B (in a separate browser or incognito window).
Open the Calendar view.
Parent A adds a new event.
Observe Parent B's calendar view.
Parent A edits an existing event.
Observe Parent B's calendar view.
Parent A deletes an event.
Observe Parent B's calendar view.
test_cases.expected_result: All changes made by Parent A (adding, editing, deleting events) are reflected in real-time on Parent B's calendar view.

test_cases.name: Create custom event category with color
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can create a new custom event category with a specific color.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to 'Event Categories' or 'Settings'.
Click 'Add New Category'.
Enter a category name (e.g., 'Sports Practice').
Select a color (e.g., blue).
Save the category.
Go to the Calendar and attempt to add a new event, selecting the new category.
Verify the category and its color are available and applied.
test_cases.expected_result: Custom event category is created and available for use when adding/editing events.

test_cases.name: View calendar in different views (Day, Week, Month)
test_cases.description: Verify that the calendar can be displayed correctly in Day, Week, and Month views.
steps: Log in to the application.
Navigate to the Calendar view.
Switch to the 'Day' view and verify events are displayed.
Switch to the 'Week' view and verify events are displayed.
Switch to the 'Month' view and verify events are displayed.
Ensure navigation between dates/weeks/months works correctly in each view.
test_cases.expected_result: Calendar displays events accurately and legibly in Day, Week, and Month views.

test_suites.description: Tests for setting up and managing recurring events.

test_cases.name: Create a daily recurring event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can create an event that repeats daily.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to 'Add Event'.
Fill in event details (title, start time, end time).
Enable the 'Recurring' option.
Select 'Daily' recurrence.
Set an end date for the recurrence (e.g., 1 week from now).
Save the event.
Verify the event appears on the calendar for the current day and subsequent days within the recurrence period.
test_cases.expected_result: The daily recurring event is created and populated on the calendar for the specified duration.

test_cases.name: Create a weekly recurring event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can create an event that repeats weekly on specific days.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to 'Add Event'.
Fill in event details (title, start time, end time).
Enable the 'Recurring' option.
Select 'Weekly' recurrence.
Choose specific days of the week (e.g., every Tuesday and Thursday).
Set an end date for the recurrence.
Save the event.
Verify the event appears on the calendar for the selected days within the recurrence period.
test_cases.expected_result: The weekly recurring event is created and populated on the calendar for the specified days and duration.

test_cases.name: Create a monthly recurring event
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can create an event that repeats monthly.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to 'Add Event'.
Fill in event details (title, start time, end time).
Enable the 'Recurring' option.
Select 'Monthly' recurrence.
Set the day of the month (e.g., the 15th).
Set an end date for the recurrence.
Save the event.
Verify the event appears on the calendar for the specified day(s) within the recurrence period.
test_cases.expected_result: The monthly recurring event is created and populated on the calendar for the specified day(s) and duration.

test_cases.name: Edit all future occurrences of a recurring event
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can edit all future occurrences of a recurring event.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Select an existing recurring event.
Choose the option to edit 'All future occurrences'.
Modify event details (e.g., change start time).
Save changes.
Verify that the selected event instance and all subsequent instances are updated.
test_cases.expected_result: All future occurrences of the recurring event are updated with the modified details.

test_cases.name: Edit a single instance of a recurring event
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can edit only a single instance of a recurring event.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Select a specific instance of a recurring event.
Choose the option to edit 'This instance only'.
Modify event details (e.g., change title, mark as complete).
Save changes.
Verify that only the selected instance is updated, while other instances remain unchanged.
test_cases.expected_result: Only the selected instance of the recurring event is modified, leaving future instances intact.

test_suites.description: Tests for creating, assigning, viewing, and completing tasks by parents and children.

test_cases.name: Parent creates and assigns a task
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can create a new task and assign it to a child.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the 'Tasks' section.
Click 'Add Task'.
Enter task title and description.
Set a due date (optional).
Assign the task to a specific child.
Save the task.
Verify the task appears in the parent's task list and the child's assigned tasks list.
test_cases.expected_result: Task is created successfully and assigned to the specified child. Visible to both parent and child.

test_cases.name: Child views assigned tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that a child can view the list of tasks assigned to them.
steps: Log in as a child user.
Navigate to the 'My Tasks' or 'Tasks' section.
Verify that the task created in E2E-TASK-001 is visible in the list.
Check that tasks assigned to other children (if any) are not visible.
test_cases.expected_result: The child can see a clear list of all tasks assigned specifically to them, including title, description, and due date.

test_cases.name: Child marks a task as completed
test_cases.description: Verify that a child can mark an assigned task as completed.
steps: Log in as a child user.
Navigate to 'My Tasks'.
Locate an uncompleted task.
Click the 'Mark as Complete' button or checkbox.
Verify the task's status changes to 'Completed'.
Log in as the parent.
Navigate to the parent's task view.
Verify that the completed task is marked as done by the child.
test_cases.expected_result: Child can mark tasks as complete. Parent can see the task marked as completed by the child.

test_cases.name: Parent views completed tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can see a summary or list of tasks completed by their children.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the 'Tasks' overview or dashboard.
Verify that tasks marked as complete by children are clearly indicated.
Check if there's a filter or view to see only completed tasks.
test_cases.expected_result: Parent has clear visibility into which tasks have been completed by their children.

test_cases.name: Task assignment to multiple children
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can assign a single task to multiple children.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Create a new task.
Select multiple children for assignment.
Save the task.
Log in as each assigned child.
Verify the task appears in each child's task list.
test_cases.expected_result: The task is assigned to all selected children and appears in their respective task lists.

test_suites.description: Tests for setting up rewards, assigning points to tasks, and children redeeming rewards.

test_cases.name: Parent defines a redeemable reward
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can create a new reward with a specific point cost.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the 'Rewards' section.
Click 'Add New Reward'.
Enter reward name (e.g., 'Extra Screen Time').
Enter description (e.g., '30 extra minutes of tablet time').
Set a point cost (e.g., 50 points).
Optionally set 'Requires Approval'.
Save the reward.
Verify the reward is listed in the available rewards.
test_cases.expected_result: Reward is successfully created and added to the list of available rewards for children.

test_cases.name: Parent assigns points to a task
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can assign a point value to a task.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Create a new task (or edit an existing one).
Enter a point value for task completion (e.g., 10 points).
Save the task.
Verify the point value is associated with the task.
test_cases.expected_result: The point value is saved with the task and will be awarded upon completion.

test_cases.name: Child views current point balance
test_cases.description: Verify that a child can see their accumulated points balance.
steps: Log in as a child user.
Navigate to the 'Rewards' or 'Points' section.
Verify that the current point balance is displayed.
Complete a task that awards points (see E2E-REWARD-004).
Refresh the rewards/points section and verify the balance has increased.
test_cases.expected_result: Child's current point balance is accurately displayed and updates after task completion.

test_cases.name: Points awarded upon task completion
test_cases.description: Verify that points are awarded to a child when they complete a task.
steps: Log in as a child.
Have a task assigned with a point value (e.g., 10 points).
Mark the task as completed.
Check the child's point balance (either via UI or by querying the backend).
Verify the point balance has increased by the task's point value.
test_cases.expected_result: Upon task completion, the associated points are added to the child's account balance.

test_cases.name: Child redeems an available reward
test_cases.description: Verify that a child can redeem an available reward if they have sufficient points.
steps: Log in as a child.
Ensure the child has enough points (e.g., 50 points).
Navigate to the 'Rewards' section.
Select a reward with a cost less than or equal to the child's points (e.g., 'Extra Screen Time' for 50 points).
Click 'Redeem'.
Confirm redemption.
Verify the reward is listed as redeemed by the child.
Verify the child's point balance has decreased by the reward's cost.
If 'Requires Approval' is true, verify the redemption status is 'Pending Approval'.
test_cases.expected_result: Child can redeem a reward, points are deducted, and the redemption is recorded. Status reflects approval requirement.

test_cases.name: Child attempts to redeem reward with insufficient points
test_cases.description: Verify that a child cannot redeem a reward if they do not have enough points.
steps: Log in as a child.
Ensure the child has fewer points than the cost of a specific reward.
Navigate to the 'Rewards' section.
Attempt to redeem the reward.
Verify that redemption is blocked or an error message is displayed.
test_cases.expected_result: The system prevents the redemption of rewards when the user lacks sufficient points.

test_cases.name: Parent approves/denies a reward redemption
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can approve or deny a reward redemption that requires approval.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Create a reward that requires approval (see E2E-REWARD-001).
Log in as a child and redeem this reward (ensure they have enough points).
Log back in as the parent.
Navigate to the 'Pending Approvals' or rewards management section.
Locate the child's redemption request.
Approve the request.
Verify the redemption status is updated to 'Approved'.
Verify the child's points balance is deducted.
Repeat steps to deny the request and verify status is 'Denied' and points are not deducted (or are returned).
test_cases.expected_result: Parent can manage reward redemptions, approving or denying them, with corresponding point adjustments.

test_suites.description: Tests for connecting Google Calendar and syncing events.

test_cases.name: Connect Google Calendar account
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can successfully connect their Google Calendar account.
steps: Log in to FamilyFlow.
Navigate to 'Settings' or 'Integrations'.
Click 'Connect Google Calendar'.
Complete the Google OAuth authentication flow.
Grant necessary permissions to FamilyFlow.
Verify a success message and confirmation of the connected account.
test_cases.expected_result: Google Calendar account is successfully connected to FamilyFlow.

test_cases.name: Import events from Google Calendar
test_cases.description: Verify that events from Google Calendar can be imported into FamilyFlow.
steps: Ensure Google Calendar is connected (E2E-SYNC-001).
Navigate to the Calendar sync settings.
Select an option to 'Import Events' from Google Calendar.
Specify a date range if applicable.
Initiate the import.
Verify that events from the connected Google Calendar appear in the FamilyFlow calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: Events from the user's Google Calendar are imported and displayed within FamilyFlow.

test_cases.name: Export events to Google Calendar
test_cases.description: Verify that events created in FamilyFlow can be exported to Google Calendar.
steps: Ensure Google Calendar is connected (E2E-SYNC-001).
Create a new event in FamilyFlow (e.g., 'Family Outing').
Navigate to Calendar sync settings.
Ensure 'Export Events' is enabled.
Check the connected Google Calendar.
Verify the newly created FamilyFlow event appears in Google Calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: Events created in FamilyFlow are successfully exported to the connected Google Calendar.

test_cases.name: Real-time sync: FamilyFlow to Google Calendar
test_cases.description: Verify that changes in FamilyFlow events sync to Google Calendar in near real-time.
steps: Ensure Google Calendar is connected and exporting is enabled.
Create or edit an event in FamilyFlow.
Wait for the sync interval (e.g., a few minutes).
Check the connected Google Calendar.
Verify the event in Google Calendar reflects the changes made in FamilyFlow.
test_cases.expected_result: Updates to FamilyFlow events are synced to Google Calendar promptly.

test_cases.name: Real-time sync: Google Calendar to FamilyFlow
test_cases.description: Verify that changes in Google Calendar events sync to FamilyFlow in near real-time.
steps: Ensure Google Calendar is connected and importing is enabled.
Create or edit an event in the connected Google Calendar.
Wait for the sync interval.
Check the FamilyFlow calendar.
Verify the event in FamilyFlow reflects the changes made in Google Calendar.
test_cases.expected_result: Updates to Google Calendar events are synced to FamilyFlow promptly.

test_cases.name: Disconnect Google Calendar
test_cases.description: Verify that a user can disconnect their Google Calendar account.
steps: Ensure Google Calendar is connected.
Navigate to 'Settings' or 'Integrations'.
Click 'Disconnect Google Calendar'.
Confirm disconnection.
Verify that the connection status is updated and no further syncs occur.
test_cases.expected_result: Google Calendar connection is successfully removed, and sync functionality is disabled.

test_cases.name: Receive notification for upcoming event
test_cases.description: Verify that users receive a notification before an event starts.
steps: Create a calendar event with a start time in the near future (e.g., 15 minutes from now).
Ensure the user has notifications enabled.
Wait for the notification trigger time (e.g., 5 minutes before the event).
Verify that a push notification is received on the device/app.
Click the notification and verify it navigates to the event details.
test_cases.expected_result: User receives a timely notification for an upcoming event.

test_cases.name: Receive notification for new task assignment
test_cases.description: Verify that users receive a notification when a new task is assigned to them.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Assign a task to a child user.
Ensure the child user has task notifications enabled.
Log in or check the child's device/app.
Verify that a push notification is received for the new task assignment.
Click the notification and verify it navigates to the task details.
test_cases.expected_result: User receives a notification immediately after being assigned a new task.

test_cases.name: Receive notification for task deadline
test_cases.description: Verify that users receive a notification when a task deadline is approaching.
steps: Create a task with a due date in the near future.
Ensure the user has task deadline notifications enabled.
Wait for the notification trigger time (e.g., 1 hour before deadline).
Verify that a push notification is received.
Click the notification and verify it navigates to the task details.
test_cases.expected_result: User receives a timely notification for an approaching task deadline.

test_cases.name: Manage notification preferences
test_cases.description: Verify that users can enable or disable different types of notifications.
steps: Log in to the application.
Navigate to 'Notification Settings'.
Toggle off 'Event Reminders'.
Save settings.
Create an event and verify no reminder notification is received.
Toggle 'Event Reminders' back on.
Toggle off 'New Task Notifications'.
Assign a task and verify no notification is received by the child.
Toggle back on.
test_cases.expected_result: Users can successfully manage their notification preferences, and these settings affect received notifications.

test_suites.description: Tests for sharing the family account with a co-parent.

test_cases.name: Invite a co-parent to the family account
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can invite another user to join their family account.
steps: Log in as Parent A.
Navigate to 'Family Settings' or 'Invite Member'.
Enter the email address of the co-parent (Parent B).
Send the invitation.
Verify an invitation record is created.
test_cases.expected_result: An invitation is successfully sent to the specified co-parent's email address.

test_cases.name: Co-parent accepts invitation and joins family
test_cases.description: Verify that an invited co-parent can accept the invitation and join the family.
steps: Log in as Parent B (using the invited email).
Locate the invitation (e.g., via email link or in-app notification).
Accept the invitation.
If Parent B is new, complete signup. If existing, log in.
Verify Parent B is now part of Parent A's family.
Check that Parent B can now see shared calendar events and tasks.
test_cases.expected_result: Invited user successfully joins the family account and gains access to shared data.

test_cases.name: Shared access to calendar and tasks
test_cases.description: Verify that both parents have access to view and manage shared family calendar and tasks.
steps: Log in as Parent A.
Add a calendar event and create a task.
Log out.
Log in as Parent B.
Navigate to the Calendar and Tasks sections.
Verify that the event and task created by Parent A are visible and manageable (if permissions allow) by Parent B.
test_cases.expected_result: Both linked parents have synchronized access to the family's shared calendar and task lists.

test_cases.name: Remove a family member (co-parent)
test_cases.description: Verify that a parent can remove another family member (co-parent) from the account.
steps: Log in as Parent A.
Navigate to 'Family Settings'.
Locate Parent B in the member list.
Select the option to remove Parent B.
Confirm removal.
Log in as Parent B.
Verify Parent B no longer has access to the family account.
Verify Parent B's data is handled according to policy (e.g., data retention or removal).
test_cases.expected_result: The specified family member is removed from the account, revoking their access.

test_suites.description: Tests for handling unexpected inputs, network issues, and error conditions.

test_cases.name: Attempt to create event with invalid date/time
test_cases.description: Verify error handling when attempting to create an event with illogical date/time values.
steps: Log in as a user.
Attempt to create a new event.
Enter an end time that is before the start time.
Submit the form.
Verify an appropriate validation error message is displayed.
Attempt to create an event with a date in the far past.
test_cases.expected_result: Input validation prevents submission of invalid date/time data and provides user-friendly error messages.

test_cases.name: Upload invalid avatar file type
test_cases.description: Verify error handling when uploading an avatar with an unsupported file type.
steps: Log in as a user.
Navigate to profile settings.
Attempt to upload a file that is not an image (e.g., a .txt or .pdf file).
Submit the upload.
Verify an error message indicating the unsupported file type is displayed.
test_cases.expected_result: The system rejects unsupported file types for avatars and informs the user.

test_cases.name: Network interruption during data submission
test_cases.description: Simulate network interruption during critical data submission (e.g., saving an event) and verify graceful handling.
steps: Log in as a user.
Start creating/editing an event.
Simulate a network disconnection (e.g., using browser developer tools or disabling network).
Attempt to save the event.
Verify that an appropriate message is shown to the user (e.g., 'Failed to save. Check connection.').
Restore network connection.
Verify the application attempts to resync or prompts the user to retry saving.
test_cases.expected_result: Application handles network interruptions gracefully, informs the user, and allows for retry upon connection restoration.

test_cases.name: Invalid credentials during login (API level)
test_cases.description: Test the API endpoint for login with invalid credentials to ensure proper error response.
steps: Send a POST request to the /auth/login endpoint.
Use an invalid email/password combination.
Observe the HTTP status code and response body.
test_cases.expected_result: API returns a 401 Unauthorized or 400 Bad Request status code with a clear error message.

test_cases.name: Attempt to access protected resource without authentication
test_cases.description: Verify that accessing authenticated API endpoints without a valid token returns an error.
steps: Send a GET request to a protected endpoint (e.g., /calendar/events).
Do not include an Authorization header or use an invalid/expired token.
Observe the HTTP status code and response body.
test_cases.expected_result: API returns a 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden status code.

test_suites.description: Tests focused on the user interface and overall user experience.

test_cases.name: Responsive design on different screen sizes
test_cases.description: Verify that the application UI adapts correctly to various screen sizes (if applicable for web or simulated device sizes in RN).
steps: Access the application on different simulated devices (e.g., phone, tablet) or resize the browser window.
Navigate through key sections (Dashboard, Calendar, Tasks, Profile).
Verify that layout elements adjust properly, text is readable, and interactive elements are accessible.
test_cases.expected_result: The application's user interface is responsive and usable across different screen dimensions.

test_cases.name: Intuitive navigation
test_cases.description: Verify that users can easily navigate between different sections of the application.
steps: Start from the dashboard.
Use the main navigation menu to go to Calendar.
Navigate to Tasks.
Go to Profile/Settings.
Use back buttons or breadcrumbs where applicable.
Verify that navigation is consistent and predictable.
test_cases.expected_result: Users can effortlessly move between different features and sections of the application.

test_cases.name: Clarity of event and task details display
test_cases.description: Verify that event and task details are presented clearly and concisely.
steps: Create events and tasks with various details (description, location, assigned user, time, etc.).
View these items in calendar and task lists.
Click on items to view their full details.
Verify that all information is displayed in an organized and easy-to-understand manner.
test_cases.expected_result: All relevant information for events and tasks is clearly and logically displayed.

test_suites.description: Tests focusing on security aspects of the application.

test_cases.name: Password complexity enforcement
test_cases.description: Verify that the system enforces password complexity rules during signup.
steps: Navigate to the signup page.
Attempt to sign up with a weak password (e.g., 'password', '123456').
Verify an error message regarding password requirements is shown.
Attempt to sign up with a password that meets requirements but is common (e.g., 'password123').
Attempt to sign up with a password that meets requirements (e.g., 'P@sswOrd!123').
test_cases.expected_result: The system enforces minimum password length, complexity (uppercase, lowercase, number, special character), and rejects weak passwords.

test_cases.name: Secure handling of JWT tokens
test_cases.description: Verify that JWT tokens are transmitted securely (HTTPS) and handled appropriately.
steps: Perform a login operation.
Inspect the network traffic for the login response containing the JWT.
Verify the token is transmitted over HTTPS.
Make a subsequent authenticated request and verify the 'Authorization: Bearer <token>' header is sent.
Attempt to use an expired token and verify a 401 Unauthorized response.
test_cases.expected_result: JWT tokens are transmitted securely and used correctly for authentication. Expired tokens result in unauthorized access.

test_cases.name: OAuth 2.0 flow security for Google Sign-In
test_cases.description: Verify the security of the Google Sign-In flow, ensuring proper redirection and token handling.
steps: Initiate Google Sign-In.
Observe the redirect URLs and parameters during the OAuth flow.
Ensure sensitive information is not exposed in URLs.
Complete the sign-in and verify a valid session is established without exposing Google credentials directly.
Attempt to manipulate OAuth parameters (e.g., state parameter) to ensure security measures are in place.
test_cases.expected_result: Google Sign-In follows secure OAuth 2.0 practices, protecting user credentials and session integrity.

test_suites.description: Tests for features like 21-Day Routine Builder, In-App Messaging, Analytics, etc.

test_cases.name: 21-Day Routine Builder - Setup and Tracking
test_cases.description: Verify the functionality of the 21-Day Routine Builder.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the '21-Day Routine Builder'.
Start creating a new routine (e.g., 'Morning Chores').
Define daily steps or goals for the routine.
Assign the routine to a child.
Log in as the child and mark a day as complete.
Log back in as the parent and verify the progress tracking visually.
Verify the child can mark subsequent days as complete.
test_cases.expected_result: Users can create and track progress within the 21-Day Routine Builder, with visual feedback on completed days.

steps: Make bed
Brush teeth
Get dressed

test_cases.name: Parent-to-Child In-App Messaging
test_cases.description: Verify that parents can send messages to their children within the app.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Navigate to the child's profile or a dedicated messaging section.
Compose a short message (e.g., 'Have a great day at school!').
Send the message.
Log in as the child.
Check their messages or profile.
Verify the message from the parent is received.
test_cases.expected_result: Parents can send messages to children, and children can view these messages within the app.

test_data.message: Have a great day at school!

test_cases.name: Subscription Payment Gateway Integration
test_cases.description: Verify the integration with a payment gateway for premium subscriptions.
steps: Log in as a user (ensure not already subscribed).
Navigate to the subscription/upgrade section.
Select a monthly subscription plan.
Proceed to the payment gateway checkout.
Enter valid (test mode) payment details.
Complete the payment process.
Verify redirection back to the application with a success message.
Check the user's account status to confirm they now have premium features.
Verify subscription details (plan, start date) are recorded.
test_cases.expected_result: Users can successfully subscribe to premium features via the integrated payment gateway.

test_cases.name: Parental Dashboard Overview - Upcoming Events
test_cases.description: Verify that the parental dashboard displays upcoming family events.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Ensure there are several upcoming events scheduled (some for today, some for the next few days).
Navigate to the Parental Dashboard.
Verify that a section clearly lists the upcoming events, showing at least the event title and time.
Check that events beyond the defined 'upcoming' window (e.g., > 3 days) are not shown, or are in a separate section.
test_cases.expected_result: The parental dashboard provides a concise view of imminent family events.

test_cases.name: Parental Dashboard Overview - Pending Tasks & Points
test_cases.description: Verify that the parental dashboard displays pending tasks and children's points summary.
steps: Log in as a parent.
Ensure there are pending tasks assigned to children.
Ensure children have accumulated some points.
Navigate to the Parental Dashboard.
Verify a section shows pending tasks for each child.
Verify a section shows a summary of points earned by each child.
test_cases.expected_result: The parental dashboard provides a clear overview of children's pending tasks and reward point status.
